notes: Classic very low-mass arm. The fixed headshell version of the Improved S2. Ideal for high-compliance cartridges like Shure V15 III.
The classic low-mass arm with a removable headshell, making it slightly heavier than the fixed version. Still best for high-compliance cartridges.
A benchmark for budget to mid-priced tonearms for decades. VTA requires shims. Rega's geometry is a Stevenson variant.
Legendary heavy-mass arm from Technics with variable dynamic damping. Excellent for low-compliance MCs like the Denon DL-103.
A very popular and versatile modern medium-to-heavy S-shaped arm. Features oil damping.
The original version of Linn's reference tonearm, predecessor to the Ekos SE.
A classic linear tracking tonearm that uses a quartz rod and rides on a track. Extremely low mass.
A high-quality tonearm from a renowned manufacturer.  Known for its performance and build quality.
The final version of the SME Series IV, with improved damping.
Insufficient data available to populate numerous fields. Further research required.

edit_history.changes: Verified manufacturer URL.  Added 'notes' field to reflect data limitations.

notes: A modern, purely mechanical tangential tracking tonearm.
A modern high-end tonearm featuring a unique tri-point bearing. Medium mass.
A well-built vintage Japanese tonearm, often paired with their own high-output MC cartridges.
An updated version of the unique bi-axis tonearm, acclaimed for its tracking stability.
A highly regarded Japanese unipivot tonearm with oil damping. Known for its clean and musical sound.
A very popular and versatile modern medium-to-heavy S-shaped arm. Features oil damping.
A professional quality tonearm from Sony's broadcast division.
The successor to the Formula IV, with a more sophisticated damping system.
A distinctive unipivot tonearm from New Zealand with a large-diameter carbon fiber armtube.
Known for its tangential tracking mechanism.  Precise specifications regarding internal wiring and capacitance are difficult to ascertain from available sources.
Known for its unique unipivot bearing and s-shaped design.  Some specifications are estimations based on available information.
sources: Triplanar's official website (archived copy used where current site unavailable)
User reviews collated from various online forums (anonymized)

notes: Known for its innovative unipivot design and exceptional build quality.  Often praised for its musicality and dynamic range.
High quality, well-regarded tonearm known for its build quality and performance.
